answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Understand your predicament.With the aortic root dilatation is there any evidence of aortic regurgitation? The prognosis depends on your clinical presentation, the present diameter and the other co morbid conditions like diabetes. For LAD stenosis, if it is causing significant blockage then intervention may be planned. If your symptoms are adequately controlled with medications then you may not need any intervention now.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

Thanks!I again had ecocardiography done. Its final diagnosis are: Mild concentric LVH; Grade II LV diastolic dysfunction; dilated aortic root, ascending aorta upto first batch; mild to moderate aortic regurgitation; normal LV systolic function.Dilation of sinotubular junction is causing incomplete coaptation of aortic valve producing Aortic regurgitation.

Hello and hope you are doing well.In general, a dilated ascending aorta measuring 5cm diameter is indication for replacement with a fabric graft. But this again is correlated with your clinical symptoms and other co morbid conditions like diabetes and hypertension.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.
